algorithm_technique: Use a hash map to store the last seen index of each number. Check distance if a duplicate is found.
problem_summary_simple: Find if there are duplicates within a certain distance k in an array.
problem_summary_technical: Track last seen indices in a hash map; check if current index minus stored index is within k for duplicates.
key_insights: A hash map is ideal for storing and quickly retrieving the last seen index of an element.
The condition `i - lookup[num] <= k` efficiently checks the distance constraint.
Updating the index in the map ensures we always consider the closest previous occurrence.
